title: Upgrade external UD/UCMDB (managed Kubernetes)
content:
If the suite is integrated with UD/UCMDB, follow the instructions below to upgrade UD/UCMDB.

Supported UD/UCMDB versions

Find the supported UD/UCMDB versions in one of the following sections on the Integration Central:

  • Service Management integration with classic Universal Discovery and CMDB (UCMDB) via Native SACM solution
  • Service Management integration with containerized Universal Discovery and CMDB (UCMDB) via Native SACM solution
  • Service Management integration with classic Universal Discovery and CMDB (UCMDB) via OPB
You must perform the before-and-after upgrade tasks only when you upgrade from version 25.3 to 25.4. If you are upgrading from 25.2 or 25.2.2 to 25.3.1 or 25.3.2, you can skip these tasks.

Before upgrading to UD/UCMDB 25.4

Perform the following tasks only when you upgrade from version 25.3 to 25.4. Otherwise, proceed with the next section.
  1. Set the number of replicas for the itom-cms-gateway deployment in the UCMDB namespace to 0.
  2. Go to the NFS server and navigate to the data volume of UCMDB.
  3. Delete all the folders named model-<customerId> from the folder: <dataVolumePath>/cms-gateway/data_model_custom/. For example, rm -rf /var/vols/itom/data/cms-gateway/data_model_custom/model-1.

Upgrade UD/UCMDB

Upgrade your UD/UCMDB (classic or containerized). 

For classic UD/UCMDB, you can upgrade it separately with no dependency on other components; for containerized UD/UCMDB, see Version update steps for the upgrade sequence requirements, if any.

Upgrade Classic UD/UCMDB

The 25.1 release doesn't include a new version of the classic UD/UCMDB and UCMDB Gateway. You can continue to use classic UD/UCMDB 24.4 and UCMDB Gateway 24.4 after upgrading the suite to this release.

Upgrade containerized UD/UCMDB

If you installed the containerized UD/UCMDB, follow the steps below to upgrade UD/UCMDB.

  1. Back up the UD/UCMDB deployment
  2. Upgrade the UD/UCMDB deployment
  3. Upgrade the content pack

If the upgrade fails, you can restore the UD/UCMDB deployment.

After upgrading to UD/UCMDB 25.4

Perform the following tasks only when you upgrade from version 25.3 to 25.4. Otherwise, ignore these steps.
For every SMAX tenant that has Native SACM enabled.
  1. Log in to the tenant with an admin user.
  2. Go to https://<smax-external-access-host>:<external-access-port>/sap/rest-client?TENANTID=<tenantId>.
  3. Set the method to PUT and fill the path with cmsx/reset.
  4. Click Send. If you see a response with status 200, the step is successful.
